appShortName.description: The short name of the application

appDescription.message: A tool to install, manage and use Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) in Mozilla Firefox

actionInstallSite.description: Instruct users that they can install the current site here

actionLaunchSite.description: Instruct users that they can launch the current site here

setup-PWAsForFirefox-title.message: Setup Progressive Web Apps for Firefox
setup-PWAsForFirefox-title.description: The title of the setup page

license-agreement.description: The title of the license agreement

connector-installation.description: The title of the connector installation

runtime-installation.description: The title of the runtime installation

ready.description: The title of the ready page

license-MPL2.0.message: The project is licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. By using, redistributing, or modifying it, you must agree to the license, and the additional clauses provided below.

third-party-code.message: The project uses additional third-party assets and code:
third-party-code.description: The title of the third party code

logo-based-on-notice.message: The project logo is based on "Fox SVG Vector" icon and the community-introduced PWA logo, both dedicated to the public domain using CC0.

firefox-scripts-notice.message: Browser chrome modifications were inspired by and partially derived from the xiaoxiaoflood/firefox-scripts repository on GitHub, licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Detailed information can be found in the respective files.
firefox-scripts-notice.description: The notice for the Firefox scripts

firefox-ui-fix-notice.message: Browser chrome modifications partially use code derived from the black7375/Firefox-UI-Fix repository on GitHub, licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Detailed information can be found in the respective files.

firefox-source-code-notice.message: Browser chrome modifications partially use code and icons derived from the original Firefox source, licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Detailed information can be found in the respective files.

metropolis-by-chris-simpson-notice.message: Native programs contain the Metropolis Semi Bold typeface by Chris Simpson, released into the public domain using Unlicense.

bootstrap-icon-notice.message: Windows installer contains Bootstrap Icons, licensed under the the MIT License. Detailed license information can be found in the WiX configuration file.
bootstrap-icon-notice.description: The notice for the Bootstrap Icons

additional-program-install-by-user-notic.message: Additional open source software will be downloaded and installed at runtime when initiated by the user:
additional-program-install-by-user-notic.description: The header for the notice for additional program installation

7-zip-notice.message: Installing the runtime on Windows will install 7-Zip if it is not already installed. The 7-Zip project is made by Igor Pavlov and licensed under the GNU LGPL license and others. This project is not affiliated with the 7-Zip project or its developers in any way.

firefox-notice.message: Installing the runtime on any system will download the unmodified Mozilla Firefox browser and locally modify it. By using this project, you also agree to the Firefox Privacy Notice. Firefox is licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Firefox and the Firefox logo are trademarks of the Mozilla Foundation in the U.S. and other countries. This project is not affiliated with the Mozilla Foundation in any way.

privacy-notice-before-install.message: This extension exchanges personal data (current website and manifest URLs, as well as other PWA details) with the native program when the user initiates the PWA installation. This is necessary in order to correctly obtain and parse the Web Application Manifest and install the PWA. Data are stored on the computer as long as that PWA is installed. No personal data leave the computer or are sent to third parties.

accept-license-agreement.description: The label for the license agreement

install-runtime-page-top.message: You need to install the additional program so the extension can manage and run separate runtime and profiles for your web apps. The extension will not work  without this program. Please follow the instructions below to install it.
install-runtime-page-top.description: The top of the install runtime page

error-install-runtime.message: Error: The version of a currently-installed program may be incompatible with the current version of the extension. You need to update the program or the extension to a compatible version to make them work correctly.
error-install-runtime.description: The error message for the runtime installation

runtime-auto-install.message: This extension also needs a separate Mozilla Firefox runtime where all your Progressive Web App sites will run. Pressing the button below will automatically download the unmodified Mozilla Firefox from the Mozilla servers and locally modify it with the required modifications. You can also check the advanced options below to manually install the runtime.
runtime-auto-install.description: The text for the runtime auto-installation

runtime-manual-install.message: This extension also needs a separate Mozilla Firefox runtime where all your Progressive Web App sites will run. However, your platform currently does not support automatic installation of the runtime. Please follow the advanced options below to install it manually.
runtime-manual-install.description: The text for the runtime manual installation

runtime-needs-7zip.message: To install the runtime, you will need 7-Zip installed. Installing the runtime will automatically trigger the 7-Zip installer if needed. This may require accepting User Account Control prompt. You can also manually install 7-Zip or use your existing 7-zip installation. After the runtime is installed, you can delete 7-Zip manually.
runtime-needs-7zip.description: The text for the runtime needing 7-Zip

after-install-runtime.message: After the runtime is installed, you should be automatically proceeded to the next step. If nothing changes after around 30 seconds, restart the browser.
after-install-runtime.description: The text after the runtime is installed

install-the-runtime.description: The button to install the runtime

manually-install-runtime.message: Manually installing Firefox from the archive:
manually-install-runtime.description: The button to manually install the runtime

manually-install-runtime-procedure.message: Download the Firefox archive from your preferred source (for example, from the official downloads page).
manually-install-runtime-procedure.description: manual for install runtime from archive

manually-install-runtime-procedure2.message: Extract the downloaded archive and copy files to the correct directory (see below).
manually-install-runtime-procedure2.description: manual for install runtime from archive

install-Firefox-with-packagemgr.message: Manually installing Firefox using package manager:
install-Firefox-with-packagemgr.description: The button to install the runtime with the package manager

install-with-pacgaemgr-procedure.message: Install Firefox using your distro's package manager (e.g., <kbd>sudo apt install firefox</kbd>, <kbd>sudo yum install firefox</kbd>, ...).
install-with-pacgaemgr-procedure.description: manual for install runtime with package manager

install-with-pacgaemgr-procedure2.message: Copy the installed Firefox files (commonly stored in <kbd>/usr/lib/firefox/</kbd>) to the correct directory (see below).
install-with-pacgaemgr-procedure2.description: manual for install runtime with package manager

use-alternative-browser-for-runtime.message: Installing an alternative Firefox-based browser (for example, LibreWolf):
use-alternative-browser-for-runtime.description: The button to use an alternative browser for the runtime

use-alternative-browser-for-runtime-proc.message: Download the "portable" archive (binary tarball) for your preferred Firefox-based browser.
use-alternative-browser-for-runtime-proc.description: manual for install runtime with alternative browser

use-alternative-browser-for-runtime-proc.message: Extract downloaded archive and copy files to the correct directory (see below).
use-alternative-browser-for-runtime-proc.description: manual for install runtime with alternative browser

use-alternative-browser-for-runtime-proc.message: Inside that directory, symlink the main binary of your browser (for example, <kbd>librewolf.exe</kbd>/<kbd>librewolf-bin</kbd>) as <kbd>firefox.exe</kbd>/<kbd>firefox</kbd>.
use-alternative-browser-for-runtime-proc.description: manual for install runtime with alternative browser

default-runtime-location-windows.description: The default runtime location for Windows

default-runtime-location-linux.description: The default runtime location for Linux

default-runtime-location-macos.description: The default runtime location for macOS

ready-to-use.message: This extension is now ready to be used. You can close this page.
ready-to-use.description: The text for ready to use

install-PWAsForFirefox-header.description: The header for the install PWAs for Firefox page

linux-deb-install-tab.description: The tab for Linux Ubuntu installation

linux-rpm-install-tab.description: The tab for Linux Fedora installation

linux-aur-install-tab.description: The tab for Linux Arch installation

download-PWAsForFirefox-installer.message: Download and run the PWAsForFirefox MSI installer.

after-program-install.message: After the programs are installed, you should be automatically proceeded to the next step. If nothing changes after around 30 seconds, restart the browser.

install-vcruntime-from-winget.message: Install Visual C++ Redistributable using winget: winget install -e Microsoft.VCRedist.2015+..

install-PWAsForFirefox-from-winget.message: Install PWAsForFirefox using winget: winget install firefoxpwa --version
install-PWAsForFirefox-from-winget.description: The text for installing the PWAs for Firefox with the package manager

package-to-distro-notice.message: If you want to package PWAsForFirefox for your distribution or have already packaged it, please let me know, so I can help with the packaging and list it in the installation instructions. If the packaging platform supports any auto-submission/uploading feature, please also let me know, as I might integrate it directly with GitHub Actions to make sure the packages are always up-to-date.
package-to-distro-notice.description: notice about packaging PWAsForFirefox for your distribution

install-homebrew.message: Make sure Homebrew is installed.

install-PWAsForFirefox-from-brew.message: Install the formula using brew: <kbd>brew install firefoxpwa</kbd>
install-PWAsForFirefox-from-brew.description: The text for installing the PWAs for Firefox from brew

install-PWAsForFirefox-from-brew2.message: Follow instructions displayed in the caveats section of installation output to link the manifest.
install-PWAsForFirefox-from-brew2.description: The text for installing the PWAs for Firefox from brew

after-program-install-with-brew.message: After the formula is installed and the manifest is linked, you should be automatically proceeded to the next step. If nothing changes after around 30 seconds, restart the browser.
after-program-install-with-brew.description: The text after the program is installed with brew

unsupported-os-notice.message: Your operating system is not officially supported. You can try building and installing the project from source with instructions from the source installation section. You may need to adjust them to make it work with your operating system, and there is no guarantee that it will work.

update-PWAsForFirefox-header.message: Update Progressive Web Apps for Firefox
update-PWAsForFirefox-header.description: The header for updating the PWAs for Firefox

native-connector-is-out-of-date.message: The native connector is currently outdated.
native-connector-is-out-of-date.description: The text for the native connector is out of date

recommended-native-update.message: It is compatible with the current extension version, but it is strongly recommended to update it to get the latest features and fixes.
recommended-native-update.description: The text for the recommended update

have-to-native-update.message: It is not compatible with the current extension version, so you cannot use the extension until you update it.
have-to-native-update.description: The text for the have to update

follow-native-update-instructions.description: The text for following the update instructions

extension-is-out-of-date.description: The text for the extension is out of date

have-to-extension-update.message: It is not compatible with the current connector version, so you cannot use the extension until you update it.

follow-extension-update-instructions.message: Please update it from the Firefox addon manager (<kbd>about:addons</kbd>).
follow-extension-update-instructions.description: The text for following the update instructions

PWAsForFirefox-programs-are-updated.message: The extension and the native connector are updated to the same version. You can close this page.
PWAsForFirefox-programs-are-updated.description: The text for the PWAs for Firefox programs are updated

show-release-notes.message: You can read the release notes for a list of new features, bug fixes and other improvements.
show-release-notes.description: The text for showing the release notes

no-compatible-update.message: This update may contain backward-incompatible changes, so you may also need to re-configure some things as specified in the release notes to make it work.
no-compatible-update.description: The text for no compatible update

error-at-update.description: The text for the error at update
